League 1
OM: the club supports Mario Balotelli following the racist songs
This afternoon, Mario Balotelli wanted to stop the meeting between Verona and Brescia following racist songs. Olympique de Marseille has shown support for its former player.
03 Nov 2019, 20:20 by Antoine Chirat



Duje Caleta-Car Present at the World Cup with Croatia, the 21-year-old defender landed from Salzburg against 17 million euros.



Jorge Rolando Despite a serious injury, the Portuguese international has not been let loose by the Olympian club, which has extended a season, until 2019.Icon Sport



Yohann Pel√© Despite the interest of Ligue 1 clubs, the second Olympian goalkeeper has finally extended until 2020.Icon Sport

OM: Olympian recruits




Italian football is struggling to heal its wounds and racism continues to haunt its stadiums. This afternoon, the Marcantonio-Bentegodi stadium of Hellas Verona was the scene of new racist songs by supporters against Brescia player Mario Balotelli. Mad with rage, the Italian international wanted to stop the meeting, before finally returning to the field to finish the latter. Very quickly, many testimonials of support arrived, including that of Olympique Marseille, his former club. A nice message from the Phoenicians who have not forgotten "Super Mario".
